get_feature_by_id(feature_id)[source]

Returns the feature with the given id. We also build a lazy lookup cache in case the same feature is requested multiple times.

Parameters:

Raises:

property transformed_dataset

Returns a transformed dataset that uses the features from vm_dataset. Some of the features in vm_dataset are of type Dummy so we need to reverse the one hot encoding and drop the individual dummy columns

Parameters:

force_refresh (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether to force a refresh of the transformed dataset. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The transformed dataset

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

classmethod init_from_pd_dataset(df, options=None, targets=None, target_column=None, class_labels=None)[source]

Initializes a Dataset object from a pandas DataFrame

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì The pandas DataFrame to initialize the Dataset object from

  • options (dict, optional) ‚Äì The options to use when initializing the Dataset object. Defaults to None.

  • targets (list, optional) ‚Äì The targets to use when initializing the Dataset object. Defaults to None.

  • target_column (str, optional) ‚Äì The target column to use when initializing the Dataset object. Defaults to None.

  • class_labels (list, optional) ‚Äì The class labels to use when initializing the Dataset object. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The Dataset object

Dataset

class validmind.vm_models.MetricResult(type: str, scope: str, key: dict, value: dict | list | DataFrame, value_formatter: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

MetricResult class definition. A MetricResult is returned by any internal method that extracts metrics from a dataset or model, and returns 1) Metric and Figure objects that can be sent to the API and 2) and plots and metadata for display purposes

type: str
scope: str
key: dict
value: dict | list | DataFrame

predict(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Predict method for the model. This is a wrapper around the model‚Äôs predict_proba (for classification) or predict (for regression) method

NOTE: This only works for sklearn or xgboost models at the moment

class validmind.vm_models.TestContext(dataset: Dataset | None = None, model: Model | None = None, models: List[Model] = _CountingAttr(counter=40, _default=NOTHING, repr=True, eq=True, order=True, hash=None, init=True, on_setattr=None, alias=None, metadata={}), train_ds: Dataset | None = None, test_ds: Dataset | None = None, validation_ds: Dataset | None = None, y_train_predict: object | None = None, y_test_predict: object | None = None, context_data: dict | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Holds context that can be used by tests to run. Allows us to store data that needs to be reused across different tests/metrics such as model predictions, shared dataset metrics, etc.

class validmind.vm_models.TestPlan(config: {} = None, test_context: TestContext = None, _test_plan_instances: List[object] = None, dataset: Dataset = None, model: Model = None, train_ds: Dataset = None, test_ds: Dataset = None, models: List[Model] = _CountingAttr(counter=41, _default=NOTHING, repr=True, eq=True, order=True, hash=None, init=True, on_setattr=None, alias=None, metadata={}), pbar: tqdm = None)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for test plans. Test plans are used to define any arbitrary grouping of tests that will be run on a dataset or model.

name: ClassVar[str]
required_context: ClassVar[List[str]]
tests: ClassVar[List[object]] = []
test_plans: ClassVar[List[object]] = []
results: ClassVar[List[TestPlanResult]] = []
config: {} = None
test_context: TestContext = None
dataset: Dataset = None
model: Model = None
train_ds: Dataset = None
test_ds: Dataset = None
models: List[Model] = _CountingAttr(counter=41, _default=NOTHING, repr=True, eq=True, order=True, hash=None, init=True, on_setattr=None, alias=None, metadata={})
pbar: tqdm = None
title()[source]

Returns the title of the test plan. Defaults to the title version of the test plan name

description()[source]

Returns the description of the test plan. Defaults to the docstring of the test plan

validate_context()[source]

Validates that the context elements are present in the instance so that the test plan can be run

get_config_params_for_test(test_name)[source]

Returns the config for a given test, if it exists. The config attribute is a dictionary where the keys are the test names and the values are dictionaries of config values for that test.

The key in the config must match the name of the test, i.e. for a test called ‚Äútime_series_univariate_inspection_raw‚Äù we could pass a config like this:

{
‚Äútime_series_univariate_inspection_raw‚Äù: {

‚Äúcolumns‚Äù: [‚Äúcol1‚Äù, ‚Äúcol2‚Äù]

}

}

run(send=True)[source]

Runs the test plan

log_results()[source]

Logs the results of the test plan to ValidMind

This method will be called after the test plan has been run and all results have been collected. This method will log the results to ValidMind.

summarize()[source]

Summarizes the results of the test plan

This method will be called after the test plan has been run and all results have been logged to ValidMind. It will summarize the results of the test plan by creating an html table with the results of each test. This html table will be displayed in an VS Code, Jupyter or other notebook environment.

get_results(result_id: str | None = None) → List[TestPlanResult][source]

Returns one or more results of the test plan. Includes results from sub test plans.

class validmind.vm_models.ThresholdTest(test_context: TestContext, params: dict | None = None, test_results: TestResults | None = None)[source]

Bases: TestContextUtils

A threshold test is a combination of a metric/plot we track and a corresponding set of parameters and thresholds values that allow us to determine whether the metric/plot passes or fails.

TODO: ThresholdTest should validate required context too
